messageBody:
Jacob,

> I was going to use TestSetup, to do the extra setup for me, but where
> do I store the data? I can't store it in a subclass of TestSetup,
> because then the Test contained by TestSetup won't have access to the
> data. Is there a general way of doing this type of thing? In fact,
> more generally, JUnit doesn't seem to have any concept of test data.
> All examples and documents I've seen assume that the data can be
> hard-coded into the test itself, which is not always practical. Are
> there generally accepted ways of loading data (and hierarchies of
> data)?
>
Last week I published an article about driving unit tests with custom
scripts using SuiteRunner (a JUnit runner). I was originally planning
an article on table-driven tests, but ended up creating a simple
scripting language instead of a table of data for my example. But the
idea is the same. You can customize the way a org.suiterunner.Suite
executes its tests, including by sucking in data and using it to
perform the tests. Here's the article:

http://www.artima.com/suiterunner/scriptdriven.html

If you can't figure out how to apply this technique to your particular
problem, post to the SuiteRunner Forum and we'll try to help.

http://www.artima.com/forums/forum.jsp?forum=61

Bill
